meanings.definition: A loud noise caused by the failure of fuel to ignite in the engine of a motor vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic heard a loud backfire when the car's engine failed to start.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected backfire startled everyone in the parking lot.
meanings.sent3: The backfire from the car sounded like a mini explosion.
meanings.sent4: The backfire of the engine echoed through the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The sudden backfire made the driver jump in surprise.

meanings.definition: A plan or action that has the opposite effect to what was intended.
meanings.sent1: The marketing campaign turned into a backfire when sales decreased.
meanings.sent2: The prank was meant to be funny but ended up being a backfire.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party for Sarah was a backfire as she hated surprises.
meanings.sent4: The attempt to impress his boss turned into a backfire when he spilled coffee on him.
meanings.sent5: The decision to skip breakfast was a backfire as he felt faint during the meeting.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect to what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His attempt to fix the leak backfired when he made it worse.
meanings.sent2: The plan to surprise her backfired when she found out beforehand.
meanings.sent3: Trying to be sneaky backfired on him when he got caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The shortcut he took backfired, and he ended up getting lost.
meanings.sent5: Her attempt to save time by skipping steps backfired, leading to mistakes.
